comments.body: But the links did work, this is shorter though.
It was broken after https://github.com/akka/alpakka/pull/1015 and can be seen here: https://developer.lightbend.com/docs/alpakka/snapshot/slick.html

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1,5 @@# Slick (JDBC)

The Slick connector provides Scala and Java DSLs to create a `Source` to stream the results of a SQL database query and a `Flow`/`Sink` to perform SQL actions (like inserts, updates, and deletes) for each element in a stream. It is built on the [Slick](http://slick.lightbend.com/) library to interact with a long list of @extref[supported relational databases](slick:supported-databases.html).

### Reported issues

comments.body:
You could define Slick Version in `Dependencies` and use it to keep it pointing to the version in use.
Looks like more API links are version dependent...
That doesn't appear to work inside URL's (https://github.com/akka/alpakka/tree/slickVersionFromDependencies)
I would find `system.registerOnTermination(_ => session.close)`  more idiomatic.
That doesn't compile (`missing argument type`) but I rewrote it to `system.registerOnTermination(() => session.close())`

ah, it is just a pass by name, so you can also just do 
`system.registerOnTermination { session.close() }`
(not that it matters, I was just wondering why it did not compile)
